comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MCA-2622) (MYAIR-3444)
# 1. If the user selects a navigation tab that has a badge icon, then Monte Carlo shall execute the push notification associated with the tab badge icon.
# Note: Score tip push notification does no action. Coaching tip or Sleep library push notification updates the appropriate section and auto-navigates user to appropriate media asset.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MCA-2623) (MYAIR-3374)
# 1. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a coaching tip push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the coaching tab
# 2. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a sleep library push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the coaching tab
# 3. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when there is a badge on the coaching tab and the coaching tab is pressed, then the badge shall be removed
# 4. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a score tip push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the dashboard tab
# 5. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when there is a badge on the dashboard tab and the dashboard tab is pressed or on App launch, then the badge shall be removed
# 6. Given Monte Carlo has tab badge icons when App is closed (user or OS closed), then the previous tab badge icons shall be shown when App is re-launched.
# Note: When Monte Carlo is in foreground and a push notification is received, the push will NOT show up in system tray; it will only result in the push's associated navigation tab being badged.
# Note: For android use this command to get the Token = adb logcat -v time | grep Refreshed
# Note: For android use this command to get the AccountIdentifier = adb logcat -v time | egrep AccountIdentifier
#ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MYAIR-3528) (MCA-2521)
# 1. When App receives a push notification, regardless if App is in foreground or background, then a badge shall be shown on the App launch icon.
# 2. The badge on the App launch icon shall persist as long as there are outstanding push notifications to be actioned by user.

# Note: When App is in the background and a push notification is received the push notification details are displayed in the system tray.  When a user opens the App, regardless if opened by App Icon or system tray push notification, the App Icon badge is removed and all system tray push notifications are cleared (i.e. no longer outstanding)

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
Push notifications are enabled
notifications are enabled in System settings
existing badge icon on "Dashboard" tab has been removed
existing badge icon on "Coaching" tab has been removed

elements.name: Verify the badge icon appears over the coaching tab following a "Sleep Library" push notification when on the Settings, and removed when navigating to the "Coaching" screen

steps.name: I open the app on the "My notifications" screen
a "SleepLibrary" push notification is received
I navigate back to the "Profile" screen
I should see a badge icon on the "Coaching" tab
I tap the "Coaching" tab
I should be on the "Coaching" screen
I should not see a badge icon on the "Coaching" tab

name: Show badge icon when new data is received from patient portal or from coaching tip push notification

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-510) (MYAIR-3128)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall provide a method to contact support
# 2. The user shall be able to select a category, subcategory and question for the help request
# 3. When the user has selected a category, subcategory and question, Monte Carlo shall provide a link to the relevant support section.
# 4. The user shall be able to enter a description for the help request
# 5. The description shall be limited to 400 characters
# 6. When the user has chosen a category, subcategory, question, and written at least one character in the description, they shall be able to submit the help request
# 7. When the user has submitted the help request, Monte Carlo shall send the user's help request, first name, email address and FG serial number to Patient Portal
# Note: https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/Support+screen+improvement
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-1636) (MYAIR-2015)
# 1. If a user selects a clinically related question in the support form, then they will be shown a message to contact their care provider
# note: this behaviour is because the support service can not answer treatment or therapy related queries.
# https://confluence.ec2.local/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=39259556

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Monte Carlo shall provide a method to contact support and also read links from Support article

steps.name: I open the app on the "Settings" screen
I tap the "myAir Support" item
I should be on the "myAir Support" screen
I tap the "contact myAir support" item
I should be on the "Contact support" screen
I pick "Treatment" for the "Category" field
I pick "Side effects" for the "Subcategory" field
I pick "What can I do if I'm experiencing adverse effects?" for the "Questions" field

arguments.val: What can I do if I'm experiencing adverse effects?

steps.name: I should see the "Read now" web view link
I tap the "Read now" link
I should be on the "Side effects" screen

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-694) (MCA-2048)
# 1. Each sleep score shall be accompanied with a message according to the following rules:
# | requirement id | Condition                               | Text                                                                      | Notes                                                     |
# | 1a             | Usage is greater than 7 hours           | Excellent results, name! As you start to see the benefits in your life,   | name is replaced with the user's first name               |
# |                |                                         | you’ll never look back.                                                   |                                                           |
# | 1b             | Usage is less than or equal to 7 hours  | That's a great score! You're well on your way to improving your health.   |                                                           |
# |                | and greater than 4 hours                |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1c             | Usage is less than or equal to 4 hours  | Good start! Keep going. Like learning anything new, using therapy will    |                                                           |
# |                | and greater than 2 hours                | get easier the more you practice.                                         |                                                           |
# | 1d             | Usage is less than or equal to 2 hours  | Keep going name! If you're finding it difficult to get started, seek out  | name is replaced with the users first name                |
# |                | and greater than 0 minutes              | support. Try the myAir Library or talk to your clinician.                 |                                                           |
# | 1e             | Usage is zero minutes and the score is  | Your machine wasn't used last night! Do you need more support? Try the    |                                                           |
# |                | for the latest sleep record             | myAir Library or talk to your clinician.                                  |                                                           |
# | 1f             | Usage is zero minutes and the score is  | Your machine wasn't used this night.                                      |                                                           |
# |                | not for the latest sleep record         |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1g             | No data, score is for the latest sleep  | Last night's data isn't available yet.                                    |                                                           |
# |                | record, and there is data for the       |                                                                           |                                                           |
# |                | previous sleep record, or this is the   |                                                                           |                                                           |
# |                | only sleep record available             |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1h             | No data, score is for the latest sleep  | myAir hasn't received data from your machine for some time. To ensure     |                                                           |
# |                | record, and there has been no data for  | that your machine can send data, review the tips on the Missing Data page.|                                                           |
# |                | the most recent 2 or more sleep records |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1i             | No data, score is not for the latest    | myAir didn't receive data from your machine for this night.               |                                                           |
# |                | sleep record                            |                                                                           |                                                           |
# Note: Monte Carlo only receives the number of therapy sessions per sleep record and does not know when each therapy session starts and ends.
# Note: Monte Carlo has the timestamps when therapy starts and stops

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Verify when there is no data for the latest sleep record and there is no data for the last 2 sleep records, applicable messages appear for the latest sleep record and one sleep record before the latest sleep record

steps.name: the following sleep records exist
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
I should see the value "myAir hasn't received data from your machine for some time." in the "Score Message" label

arguments.val: myAir hasn't received data from your machine for some time.

steps.name: I should see the value "To learn more, go to Profile > Settings > myAir support > Data > Missing data." in the "Score Explanation" label

arguments.val: To learn more, go to Profile > Settings > myAir support > Data > Missing data.

steps.name: I navigate to 1 day back
I should see the value "myAir didn't receive data from your machine for this night." in the "Score Message" label

arguments.val: myAir didn't receive data from your machine for this night.

steps.name: I should not see the "Score Explanation" label

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-3536) (MYAIR-3929)
#  1.  After successful sign-in, the App shall check with the server whether the patient has a device registered with their account.
#  2.  If App receives indication from the server that the patient has a device associated with their account, then the App shall allow the patient access to all signed-in functionality

#  3.  If App receives indication from the server that the patient has no device associated with their account, then the App shall require the patient register a device before they can access any signed-in functionality (Note: Patient can still logout)
#  4.  For device registration, the App shall request the following information from the patient:
#  a) Serial number
#  b) Device number
#  5.  The App shall inform the patient if the following validation criteria are not met for the serial number:
#  5a.	only contains digits from [0-9]
#  5b.	must be 11 characters in length
#  5c.	must exist
#  5d.	must exist in patient's region
#  5e.	must not match a serial number associated with an existing account
#  6.  The App shall inform the patient if the following validation criteria are not met for the device number:
#  6a.	only contains digits from [0-9]
#  6b.	must be 3 characters in length
#  6c.	must match the device number associated with serial number

#  Note: The same generic error message is to be displayed for the following scenarios: (5c) serial number does not exist (5e) serial number is associated with an existing account (6c) device number does NOT match the device number associated with serial number
#  7.  When the patient instructs the App to register a device, the App shall notify the server to register the device to the patient's account
#  8.  The App shall allow a patient to have only one (1) device registered with their account at any given time
# Testing Notes: "FG ID is not assigned to the account":
# In order to use this account we must delete this FG ID first from the Patient Portal and later check on myAir Web that this account does not have the FG assigned.
# "More" screen in iOS is analogous to "Settings" screen in android
# For Testing iOS we are going to use the Mock
# Navigate to Test Support >> Network >> Patient Portal >> Result Error Code >> "Missing FG"
# Confluence Page: https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/V5+Patient+Portal+Endpoints#V5PatientPortalEndpoints-UpdateFlowGenerator

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
Push notifications are enabled

elements.name: User should be able to access the app if there is a Device associated with the account.

steps.name: I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
I should be on the "Dashboard" screen

elements.name: Verify when Monte Carlo receives 503 server error on the "Sign In" screen, MC will notify the user that the myAir server is under maintenance and return the user to the "Sign In" page.

steps.name: I open the app on the "Login" screen
Patient Portal will send an HTTP "503"
I enter "resmed@resmed.com" into the "Email" field
I enter "Password1" into the "Password" field
I press the "Sign in" button
I should be on the "Total Outage" screen
I tap the "Close Total Outage" icon
I should be on the "Sign in" screen

name: App Deprecation and Server Error from Patient Portal

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-158) (MYAIR-750)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall provide access to the FAQs
# Note 1: Spreadsheet with traceability is located under MYAIR-1222

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-2958) (MCA-164)
# 1. The user shall be able to view and change their first name, with a limit of 255 characters
# 2. The user shall be able to view and change their last name, with a limit of 255 characters
# 3. The user shall be able to view and change their gender to either male, female or prefer not to say
# 4. The user shall be able to view and change their date of birth, limited to be greater than 13 years before to the current date

steps.name: I clear app preferences
the logged in user has a validated phone number for SMS notifications

comments.value: # Note: iOS Connection error does not show when view appears - only when the user taps "Edit"

elements.name: After user changes gender, the edited gender persists after successful change

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
I open the app on the "About me" screen
I wait for network sync
I tap the "Edit" button
I tap the "Gender" field
I tap "Prefer not to say"
I tap the "Save" button
I wait for network sync
I press "Back"
I disable Wifi
I press "About me"
I should see the "Connection error" dialog
I dismiss the "Connection error" error message
I should see the value "Prefer not to say" in the "Gender" field
I close the app
I enable Wifi
I open the app on the "About me" screen
I wait for network sync
I should see the value "Prefer not to say" in the "Gender" field

name: View and update personal details in profile
description:
(MCA-164)
(MYAIR-2958)
As a patient
I want to update my profile
so that my Monte Carlo experience is personalised.

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-3845) (MCA-3433)
# 1. If the server indicates that the user has a validated phone number, the user shall be able to view the phone number in their profile
# 2. If the server indicates the user does not have a validated phone number, the phone number field in the profile shall be hidden
# 3. Given the user has a validated phone number in their profile, the user shall be able to change the phone number
# 4. Given the user has entered an invalid phone number length, the user shall be notified the phone number is invalid
# Note 1: The user must enter a phone number between 1 and 12 digits in length.  The server validates if the phone number is valid or invalid.
# Note: 2: The list of available countries supported is determined by server, see MYAIR-3885 for full list of countries supported by App; server may or may not support SMS for a given country.
# 5. Given the user has entered a valid phone number, they shall be asked to enter a confirmation code
# 6. Given the user has entered a confirmation code, the App shall send the confirmation code to server
# 7. If the server indicates that the confirmation is invalid, the App shall inform the user the confirmation code is invalid
# 8. If the server indicates that the user has a validated phone number, the user shall be able to delete the phone number in their profile
# Note 3: A validated phone number is one which has been matched with a confirmation code.
# Note: Default phone number for the server mock is 5555555555 (For Automation Purposes only)
# Note: "Change cell phone" screen is same as "Register cell phone" screen (For Automation Purposes only)

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Verify when user enters invalid confirmation code proper error message will appear

steps.name: the logged in user has a validated phone number for SMS notifications
I open the app on the "About me" screen
I wait for network sync
I tap the "Edit" button
I tap the "Cell phone" field
I should be on the "Register cell phone" screen
I enter "1234567890" into the "Enter cell phone" field
I press "Next"
I should be on the "Confirm cell phone" screen
I enter "CONFIRM" into the "Confirm cell phone" field
Patient Portal will return an invalid SMS validation code response
I press "Verify"
I should see the "Invalid code" text

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-502) (MYAIR-1060)
# 1. If the user is logged in, actioning a notification will open Monte Carlo to the appropriate screen
# 2. If the user is not logged in, they shall be moved to the login screen (note: default login action after logging in)
# 3. If the user actions a Coaching Push notification, the coaching section shall be updated
# Note 1: See https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/Push%2C+Coaching+Tips+and+Library for details
# Note 2: It is assumed that the Android default of having App notifications enabled has not been changed by the user
# IMPORTANT: need a clean install of the App

steps.name: notifications are enabled in System settings

elements.name: When user is logged in, opening notification will open appropriate type screen

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
Push notifications are enabled
the app is in the background
a "ScoreTip" push notification is received with body "Effective therapy is about sticking to achievable goals. For tonight, see if you can sleep 4 hours on therapy."

arguments.val: Effective therapy is about sticking to achievable goals. For tonight, see if you can sleep 4 hours on therapy.

steps.name: I open the push notification
I should be on the "Dashboard" screen

# 1. At login, the user shall be able to get help on logging in
# 2. When the user has created their account and are told to activate via email, the user shall be able to get help on activiating their account

elements.name: At login, the user shall be able to get help on logging in

I tap the "?" button
I should be on the "Sign in help" screen

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-453) (MCA-2442)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall not display the sleep score on the dashboard when there is no data for the sleep record.
# 2. The usage, mask leak, events per Hour, and Mask on/off events values and scores will be replaced with a dash.
# Note 1: This dashboard appears when there is no patient data available.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-3050) (MCA-2495)
# 1. For each sleep record, Monte Carlo shall display the usage in hours and minutes, rounded down to the nearest minute
# 2. For each sleep record, Monte Carlo shall display "Good" if the 95th percentile of the mask leak is less than 24 L/min
# 3. For each sleep record, Monte Carlo shall display "Adjust" if the 95th percentile of the mask leak is equal to or greater than 24 L/min

# 4. For each sleep record, Monte Carlo shall display the events per hour as an index of the total number of Apnea, Central Apnea and Obstructive Apnea and Hypopnea events, per hour of usage, with a tolerance of +/-0.1
# 5. For each sleep record, Monte Carlo shall display the number of mask pairs
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-1142) (MCA-2494)
# 1. If the usage for a Sleep record is zero minutes, the score shall be zero
# 2. If the usage for a sleep record is zero minutes, the *raw data values* shall be shown as a dash
# 3. If the usage for a sleep record is zero minutes, the *score breakdown values* shall be zero
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-1633) (MYAIR-2262)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall show the Sleep Score received from Patient Portal
# 2. The Sleep Score shall be displayed with the start date for the beginning of the sleep record
# 3. If new Sleep Score data is received for an existing sleep record, the most recently received Sleep Score shall be shown

steps.name: all sleep data is cleared
I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Monte Carlo displays items on the Dashboard correctly given there is no data for the selected sleep record.

steps.name: I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I see these scores
I should not see the "Sleep Score" label
I see these values

name: Show Sleep Score from Patient Portal Data

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-86)(MYAIR-2976)

# 1. If the user has been registered for 30 nights or longer, the user shall be able to see the Usage for each of the most recent 30 nights inclusive from the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night".

# 2. If the user has been registered for less than 30 nights, the user shall be able to see the Usage for each of the nights the user has been registered inclusive from the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night".
# 3. Monte Carlo shall show how the Usage score is calculated
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: User should be able to see see the Usage for less than 30 nights.

steps.name: I have "6" days of sleep data
I open the app on the "History" screen
I tap the "Usage history" button
I should see the "Usage History" values for 6 days

elements.name: User should be able to see the Usage for each of most recent 30 nights, inclusive newer "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night"

steps.name: I have "30" days of sleep data
I open the app on the "History" screen
I tap the "Usage history" button
I should see the "Usage History" values for 30 days

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-86)(MYAIR-2976)

# 1. If the user has been registered for 30 nights or longer, the user shall be able to see the Usage for each of the most recent 30 nights inclusive from the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night".

# 2. If the user has been registered for less than 30 nights, the user shall be able to see the Usage for each of the nights the user has been registered inclusive from the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night".
# 3. Monte Carlo shall show how the Usage score is calculated
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Monte Carlo shall show how the Usage score is calculated

steps.name: I open the app on the "History" screen
I tap the "Usage history" button
I should see the "How is my score calculated?" link
I tap the "How is my score calculated?" link
I should be on the "Usage hours explanation" screen
I should see a table with "Hours" and "Points" values
